title: Just a reminder that Jax has canonically slain an Ascended. How FUCKING BADASS is this.
body: He got help from Colgrim, his best friend, but STILL he was the only one that could wield a big enough weapon to execute the God Warrior. HOW FUCKING BADASS IS THAT

replies.body: Where is this from? I just reviewed his bio and "None Shall Pass" and neither mention an Ascended, so what am I missing??
Where Icathia Once Stood story. Short Story independent of any champion profile, featuring Saijax (assumed as Jax).
I believe he is confirmed as Jax.

Oh wow, where?

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}

#OH NO

######i guess i assumed
I thought I had missed a very important memo, there...

This is sufficient enough confirmation yes? :O

With help of many people, with "topping half of a mountain".

It also must be said Ascended has vast power difference even among themselves. Most of them are much weaker than Nasus, Renekton, Azir and Xerath. Even weak Nasus killed another Ascended (darkin) just because he/she trespassed his library.

And let's not forget how terrified of the Ascended Jax is. He greatly respects their power and hesitates going in combat with any of them.

So, he was not alone in his fight with Ascended, and this Ascended was high likely Ta'anari level, which is medium tier Ascended that even ages. So, it is also how badass the Ascended are too, they terrify even a master of weapons, a combat god.
no counterplay counter strike OP
Frankly he could be one. Just a thought

Yeah. He's plot armor strong for sure I just wish had less stat checky gameplay

Not nessecarily.

Aatrox was specifically mentioned to be bound to an aspect.

If the same is true for other Ascended it's likely they all have that kind of power.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=OYuJn4vl,comment-id=00000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-09-07T17:28:48.671+0000)

**one** aspect had the knowledge of how to kill the ascended and trap the rest into weapons. no ascended could do that. ascended also never had abilities and manipulation of an element. ascended are only superhumans, with superhuman abilities. aspects also can’t die to my knowledge.  aspect > ascended.

> [{quoted}](name=imgrabe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=OYuJn4vl,comment-id=000000000001000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-07T21:52:48.370+0000)
>
> **one** aspect had the knowledge of how to kill the ascended and trap the rest into weapons. no ascended could do that. ascended also never had abilities and manipulation of an element. ascended are only superhumans, with superhuman abilities. aspects also can’t die to my knowledge.  aspect > ascended.

Note, an aspect itself can't die as far as we're aware. You would probably need to destroy the spirit or whatever the hell it is, which is something that I imagine would take somebody of Sol or Nagakabourus level to do. However, their hosts CAN certainly die, and from the sounds of it, while powerful they are limited by their host's durability and flesh. Pantheon's Biography and Diana's Short Story (Where she is wounded by minor void-spawn) both give the idea that they might not be quite as powerful physically as the Ascended, thus why the Trickster Aspect relied on an Ascended to create a weapon that could destroy them, and relied on humans to do the job proper.

Honestly, the only Aspect who sounds anywhere near the level Ascended have been described as warriors is Pantheon, and even then his flesh is still confined to the limitations of the Aspects.

Pantheon's Biography and Diana's Short Story (Where she is wounded by minor void-spawn) both give the idea that they might not be quite as powerful physically as the Ascended, thus why the Trickster Aspect relied on an Ascended to create a weapon that could destroy them, and relied on humans to do the job proper.

no

>one aspect had the knowledge of how to kill the ascended and trap the rest into weapons. no ascended could do that. 

 A human can trick a wolf to walk in a cage. Doesn't mean that human wouldn't be dinner against this wolf in a combat.

I will give you that Aspects are usually more powerful yes, but that's because most of the Ascended are not high tier. Vast majority of the Ascended falls in mid tier, which they even age. They don't carry enough "soul" power or body resistant or whatever to reach their maximum potential. Such rare of humans are capable of being transformed to an high tier Ascended, like Nasus, Aatrox etc. (Our entire Ascended cast), and they outperforms other Ascended a lot.

I mean, the Ascended outnumbers Aspects overwhelmingly because Shurima Empire had this power. Why wouldn't they abuse? Why wouldn't they create their demigods when they are capable of? It is okay for humans to be not perfect for the ritual, just don't be trash enough to be obliterated by power of the Sun. Even a weak-ass Ascended is win-win for Shurima. For that, Aspects in general are more powerful than the Ascended general. But it definitely doesn't mean Xerath couldn't annihilate an Aspect's ass if he catches the chance. Myisha admits she is surprised by how well the Ascended handled the Void, and how they were more dangerous to each other than the Void. Scathlocke says high tier Ascended are functionally immortal and there aren't much to kill them. Maybe that's why Aatrox, Varus and Rhaast were imprisoned, too powerful to kill.

Celestial Ideal*

I was confused too. Then asked to WAAARGHbobo and he said it is something different. So, Aatrox never had aspect within him.

Both the Ascended and Aspects have celestial ideals within them but they represent these ideals different.
